intro: Parietaria abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian wall-rocket, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Parietaria abyssinica is often found growing in rocky or disturbed soils, and it plays a role in local ecosystems.
